response.answer_text: No, not really. Frogs and toads both have very flat heads, and this is because of their small brains. When I put them infront of a mirror, they do not notice themself ar all. They are one of those animals that has many children to keep the species going, not by having big brains to survive. Out of around 4,000 eggs, only two American toads may survive. But don't be dismayed! This does not make them less interesting to watch. Part of the little guys charm are their dumbness.

We have a toad that has lived under our deck for several years..whenever it rains hard, he hops up the three steps and hangs out under the picnic table…we assume its too wet under the deck for him..when it dries up, he goes out in the grass to hunt..he doesn't even pay any attention to us ,as hes hopped up right in front of me ..lol..so im assuming they have some cognitive thought, he remembers a nice dry spot to hang out when its not raining..and h3s approached it from both sets of step on the deck..
